website_summaries.verdict: Only ultra-rich coffee geeks should risk getting burned by the Ember mug's flashy temperature tech and insanely high price.
pros: The Ember Travel Mug precisely controls its beverage temperature
It has an alluring, distinctive design
Coffee it held at optimal temperatures had plenty of flavor
cons: It's outrageously expensive and doesn't hold much liquid
Away from its charger it retains heat for two hours or less
It uses a proprietary charging system

customer_reviews.title: Maybe worth $60, not $150.
customer_reviews.text: I never review items, but people should know the cons: Not worth $150 (maybe worth $60). Heat lasts about 30 minutes and is constantly malfunctioning (very difficult to turn on and when battery is half way full it just shuts off thinking it's dead. Have to keep trying to turn it back on). The lid is impossible to clean. The lid broke within 12 weeks of purchase. Ember has yet to contact me after I've tried contacting them multiple times. Pros: Does not spill.
customer_reviews.author: dotfaust

customer_reviews.title: On my Favorite Things list
customer_reviews.text: This mug is shortlisted as one of my Favorite Things, right after my dog. It's so nice to make a cup of coffee and then get busy doing something else, and when I come back to it my coffee's still a perfect 140°, right where I left it. Also of great importance, I was an early backer on their crowdfunding campaign, and when one of their early prototypes failed, they couldn't have been quicker to replace it. Great people! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of this
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this, I really really do. When it's working, it's pretty much the best thing ever. However, that being said, be aware that this thing does NOT keep beverage hot longer than about 45 minutes to an hour. For $150 I should get two hours. I hope future iterations improve upon this feature, because honestly, I like it enough to keep it, but I wouldn't buy it again, nor can I recommend it to a friend in good conscience.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh M.

customer_reviews.title: broke already
customer_reviews.text: Used the mug probably 10 times. Has been tricky to get to turn on from the very beginning. Now the mug says it's empty when it's not...so, it doesn't stay hot. No return or replace tab on Amazon for this product...going to have to call customer service i guess. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 2. BOTH lids broke in 1hr! No support!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE! I bought this again! And it broke on the 1st day. Really really horrible and no am customer support. The design is amazing. It is tricky to use of you don't read the directions. Secret buttons and stuff. I would not recommend buying this. It only works for an hour or two tops. We barely use it and the lid cracked, so that makes it even less effective. Just get a cheap thick thermos to do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Frank in Va

customer_reviews.title: Lid broke after 2 months of normal use
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very excited when I bought him this mug as a gift as it worked very well to keep his coffee at his preferred temperature. However, after just 2 months of use, the lid broke. I contacted the seller about a replacement and got no response. Very disappointed as this is obviously quite an expensive coffee cup.
customer_reviews.author: JoeJoeFan

customer_reviews.title: Limited by very short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be great for taking coffee with me on the go, but the battery consistently lasts less than 2 hours. I really don’t see the point of a mug like this in the first place if it is only designed to be used at home or in the office, as I can easily reheat my drink in the microwave, for example. I really think Ember needs to give the mugs batteries that last at least 3+ hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is extremely short. I have a 20 min drive into work and battery is dead 1/2 way in
customer_reviews.author: Espinosac678

customer_reviews.title: Stuck with a bad product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this early to have it for my husband for Father’s Day. He used it for a week and said the battery drains really fast. I go to return it today and the return window is closed. They need to redesign this thing, it’s crap, the battery sucks.
customer_reviews.author: BrandyAL

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. I have had issues getting it “started” and in shutting it down. I have contacted the company customer service and zero response.
customer_reviews.author: Cath

customer_reviews.title: Just be careful
customer_reviews.text: Well, what can I say? I’m disappointed. First of all it came in a soft paper packaging, risking it damaging during shipping(only corners a bit cramped, could’ve been worse). Second of all the mug didn’t charge. Battery was dead, nothing happened after three hours of trying. Third problem that they didn’t refund it fully even though I had nothing to do about the issue. Be aware this was a third party seller. Don’t buy expensive stuff from any of them! Risky.
customer_reviews.author: Vonyek

customer_reviews.title: Not there yet....
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but poor performance. I have owned mine about 9 months. It no longer charges. The connections do not charge. Poorly designed as the heat leaks out so the insulation is not very good. Cup gets hot on the outside and coffee does not stay warm long. They need to redesign starting with vacuum seal like others, better battery with longer warming time, etc. The lid is good and seals perfectly and pops open and closed very well, that part works. The bottom part has a temperature adjustment that no longer works. Short service life on this and the insulation needs to be vacuum seal and the battery does not keep warm very long.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas CFO

customer_reviews.title: For me it works great. I keep my coffee at 130 and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this initially for my wife but it didn’t really work for her mostly because she wanted it to hold more coffee. For me it works great. I keep my coffee at 130 and it seems like I get a few hours at that temp. My only issue is recently my spill proof cover stopped working and I have only had it about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Olson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!! Was very excited about this mug. ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing!! Was very excited about this mug. It doesn't keep the charge. I even bought an extra charging station for work. Says it holds the charge for 2 hours, actually only holds about 20 min unless you leave it on the charger. The on button/touch doesn't always work. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, deficient battery
customer_reviews.text: a nice and comfortable cup but its goal of maintaining heat is deficient. I hace made a comparison of another thermal cup (non electric) by putting water at the same time at 179 F in both for an hour and then taking temperature. Ember Marked 122 F and the other was at 147.2 F. Then I turn The Ember on to see if Ember would be able to march the normal mug. After 15 min Ember match the tempeture with the normal mug. The down part is that the battery died in less gran an hour. Then i took the tempeture again and ember lost tempeture again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Let me say this... it's all about the hype that people have on this product. First of all, being a battery powered to keep the drink warm, this mug does not really do the job. Even when I fully charged it, it can only keep my coffee warm for max 10-15 mins and it starts to get cold. It's even worst than my cheap regular mug that I bought at Costco. Another thing about this mug is the lid is extremely hard to clean due to the small gap underneath. Plus the bluetooth function keeps failing, I had to try to link it to my phone multiple time. Enough said, i'm returning it back.
customer_reviews.author: Cardin Tran

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep drinks hot
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in this product. I really like the idea of this mug, and have tried to get it to work; however, it just doesn't keep my coffee, tea or whatever hot.
customer_reviews.author: Go Bucks

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again in a heart beat!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! If you like coffee/tea or any hot beverage as much as I do the abality to have temperature control is something I can’t live with out not. Initially a “smart” mug seamed silly but I take it back now haha. It has a phone and watch app but I never use them as the stand along mug is all you need. The propriety charger sucks as you can have it plugged in the car or on the go but other than that it’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: A Fluffy Husky

customer_reviews.title: Can’t tell you how good or bad it was- unit won’t charge.
customer_reviews.text: So far not impressed, the proprietary charging method is definitely a minus. Also mine won’t charge, and there isn’t a number to call (I guess they only do email support). Unit was received in really good packaging and protective stickers. Set it up per the instructions and paired to app. Noticed that battery level was at 17% so placed on charger. 12 hours later battery is at 10%. Been a day since I have created the trouble ticket via email and I still haven’t heard back....
customer_reviews.author: Generally Happy

customer_reviews.title: On the 3rd lid with 5 weeks use
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea! Bad lid design. I gifted the Ember Travel Mug to my husband for Christmas. Out of nowhere, the lid broke about two weeks into using it. I contacted Ember, and they were great about quickly sending a replacement. Now it’s about two weeks into using the replacement lid and, again, the lid broke. After spending $149 on a travel coffee mug, I would not have expected this. Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Tough Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the Ember
customer_reviews.text: The mug does NOT hold enough liquid. The mug is very heavy. The charge does NOT last long even though the instructions say two hours it’s more like 20 minutes !!! The mug regulates the temperature down which is irritating when you like liquid hotter The control panel is a nuisance and simply needs to have an on and off switch Would not purchase this again. Better off to invest in a travel thermos mug that holds more liquid and will retain heat longer .
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money! You charge it all day and the battery won’t stay more than an hour!!!
customer_reviews.author: Faisal

customer_reviews.title: Much shorter battery life then stated.
customer_reviews.text: Battery only lasts 45minutes, I enjoy it more when working at my desk and keeping the mug in the charger.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey mcwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Forget Support
customer_reviews.text: Battery dies after 20 minutes , Room temperature, liquid is 150 degrees and a Full battery charge. If you are ok with 20 minutes then go for it. I do expect a better battery for the price I paid. I tried reaching out to their support team twice but no response.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Lid broken when pushed down to open for drinking

customer_reviews.title: Battery life not great, insulation poor
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is not very good and only lasts about 90 min on a full charge. The insulation in the mug is not great amd after the battery is dead it cools Down very quickly as the mug does not retain hit very well
customer_reviews.author: Romano Cecchetto

customer_reviews.title: Cool tech, but lid breaks quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun mug! It heats up your beverage to a specific temp of your choosing. The battery doesn't last forever, so I usually turn it on when I notice my coffee getting luke-warm. The challenge is that I've broken 2 lids already. I don't know of a single travel mug where a lid has broken on me, so this is quite surprising. What's worse, they didn't have black lids in stock--only white. So now I have a grungy looking lid because they are very difficult to clean (and coffee on a white lid looks horrible).
customer_reviews.author: Kai Strandskov

customer_reviews.title: Ember Mug stopped working at 2 months mark
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mug August 26, 2018 and it stopped working mid October 2018. The container keeps saying empty when there is liquid inside and it doesn’t keep liquid hot. I paid over $150 for it to stop working in two months! This is the worse product that I have purchased to date.
customer_reviews.author: Sharnitta

customer_reviews.title: Worse mug I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: This is cool looking mug and I was looking for a change. The design is very sleek easy to use. Cons: Once you take it off from the base, it does not stay hot for a long time ( max 2h). It keeps crashing too. My Chantal mug keeps the hot water , hot for 8 h.
customer_reviews.author: Roshy Pakdaman

customer_reviews.title: Gift for daughter who downloaded app
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter received this yesterday, and immediately downloaded the app. I take it that ember had an upgraded to its software, that she received the message when she returned from an appointment. She immediately made her tea, and it lit up to 145 degrees. We’re 3 hours difference, but she was headed to her freshly ground and brewed coffee this morning, and CA being the tech place she brought her mug to her favorite coffee place in Pasadena, in her new car, and her group of 7 were in Awe. Since she’s a techie DJ with Moon tribe, and her gigs are in the desert, and around the world this organic mug will get constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Edie

customer_reviews.title: THIS REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!! We have fuzted for years with heated mugs that break within 2 months...once u walk this thru, not complicated at all....every part of it quality...mug itself, lid really closes easily, nice texture to drink from...startup directions easy (they do neglect to say charge mug first, but most people know that). Husband kept his on charger, lasted well over 3 hours. I keep tea (130°) off charger for 2 hours...sure, pricey, but we have wasted way more on lesser products. Will be gifting our techy friends this holiday.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept But Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at a friends recommendation. Keeps your coffee perfectly warm in the car, at home, and work. The only complaint that I have is the battery only lasts about 1.5 to 2 hours depending on the temperature you set it at. So on a long car ride if your battery drains and you refill at a gas station or coffee shop there is no way to recharge it. I take my charger to work with me and keep the cup on the charger when I am at the desk and carry it around the hospital when I am walking around. My husband bought an extra charger for his office. Not sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Nut

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept. Poor Practicality.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of having my coffee stay at the perfect temperature! Unfortunately, this travel mug doesn’t last as long as I need while “on”. On average, I could keep my coffee perfect for an hour and a half and hen the battery would die. The mug itself is poorly insulated so once the battery would die, the coffee would be cold in a short amount of time. I could buy 7 Thermos travel mugs to keep my coffee/tea hot for 5-8 hours for the price I paid for this one. If you’re NOT traveling and only drinking coffee at home, this product is great when kept on the charger.
customer_reviews.author: John Jacobus

customer_reviews.title: Lid breaks easy
customer_reviews.text: The lid broke on 2 of them. I bought this as a gift for my girlfriend. After about 2 weeks of use the button that you push down to drink snapped. I replaced it with another thru Amazon. About 6 weeks after the same thing happened to the new one. Now I cannot replace as it’s been past 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: John Sanzberro

customer_reviews.title: weak battery , Bad performance
customer_reviews.text: This mug should not described as a travel mug weak battery , Bad performance and it cannot hold coffee heat after battery died This mug doesn’t fit any wear not for office not for travel and above all that if your drink temperature 110 - 118 the maximum temperature this mug can give before losing all the battery energy is 128 degree it doesn’t even reach the default temperature for the coffee which is 135
customer_reviews.author: khalaf

customer_reviews.title: Ember is a total fraud
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work. Charge the battery fully, doesn't last 30 min. Moreover try to heat something which is at 125 to 145, within a few minutes (2-5 min) it says battery empty. Frustrating as I bought it in the US and have travelled abroad with it, so difficult to return.
customer_reviews.author: Tarun Khandelwal

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant idea, horrible execution
customer_reviews.text: I never review but people need to be warned! This mug seems like a brilliant idea but the battery lasts at best an hour on lowest setting. The touch screen button never seems to work. A spare charger is $35! These guys have lost their minds to charge this much for NOTHING! If they don’t go bankrupt i hope version 2.0 has 10 hour battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Over priced watchmen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: It’s been 4 months and the kid has stopped working and it was a pretty expensive gift for someone and now they can’t drink out of it. I wouldn’t recommend it .
customer_reviews.author: Mlong

customer_reviews.title: Great for a techie!
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves his new Ember travel mug! He's been experimenting with temps for all his favorite drinks, but really enjoys that his drink stays exactly at the temp he likes. I think he gets a kick out of being greeted by name. I worried about the lid leaking-but it does NOT leak-wow! As others have said, battery seems to only last a few hours, but keeping it on the charger keeps it at the right temp indefinitely, and he really likes that he can slowly sip his coffee and teas instead of rushing to finish them. I've been hinting that I'd like the mug for V-day...
customer_reviews.author: Superfastmom

customer_reviews.title: 4 months then it broke.
customer_reviews.text: I used it around once or twice a week and I washed it immediately after using it. Now, after 4 months, the lid broke. Overall, it's nice with minor issues which can be negligible but paying $150 for something that breaks quickly is really unacceptable. I totally don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ambu50

customer_reviews.title: The Ember Mug is hot to hold - poor insulation
customer_reviews.text: The Mug is not insulated well enough from the outside. The Mug is hot to hold and a lot of heat is being dissipated or radiated from outside cover of the Mug. It is a good idea, but the insulation design needs to be improved. I am back using my trusted old fashion well insulated Mug, that holds my hot coffee for longer than the battery life of this Ember Mug.
customer_reviews.author: Majdi Alqahtani

customer_reviews.title: Inside of lid MELTS in coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one I returned for the same reason. The inside of the lid completely melted and caused it to fall into pieces. The first lid lasted 4/5 uses the second one melted during my first use. I've drank more plastic this week than coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte M. Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Never worked. Use a kettle and a travel mug instead.

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: It’s just a very expensive travel mug. It did not hold the temperature for more than 30 minutes. You’re better off getting a really good thermos.
customer_reviews.author: MayMay

customer_reviews.title: Ok for a few months
customer_reviews.text: It’s important to know the mug won’t warm anything below 100 degrees -your drink must already be hot - and battery life is all but gone after a few months of use (I have 2 and they both won’t hold a charge unless placed in the charging saucer (I just keep the saucer on my desk). I had the travel mug lid break so it’s not useful as a travel mug. I also had a saucer stop working because I let some liquid get in the saucer - which is really hard to avoid so I wipe the bottom of my mug clean before setting it in the saucer.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Sooooooo BAD quality ...NOT recommending at all.
customer_reviews.text: Sooooooooo bad quality... I’m do NOT buy again and NOT recommend to anyone because it’s NOT good at all. It’s not keeping warm the coffee even as a normal mugs or even disposable cups. To buy this item just WASTING money.
customer_reviews.author: Hossein

customer_reviews.title: Amazing technology!
customer_reviews.text: The Ember mug technology is remarkable. All you do is charge up the mug once a week or so and it keeps your beverages hot. You can adjust the temperature right on the mug via the digital display or through an app. An added bonus is the style- it looks really sleek. It’s a great gift idea for the serious coffee or tea drinker or the person who seems to have everything.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Perzynski

customer_reviews.title: would not hold temperature.
customer_reviews.text: had to return two mugs. they would not hold temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mug. Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised! Rapidly cools my overly hot coffee in the morning to the right temperature and then holds the temperature for the 2 hours it advertises it will. The outer shell is a soft rubber comfortable grip. Very high quality build and cool display that completely hides when not viewing to look like a simple mug. Obviously, I wish the battery lasted longer, but 2 hours is good and I understand there is only so much battery that can fit in a mug. An added bonus I never thought of how nice it would be to KNOW I am not going to burn my mouth when I take a sip since the mug display tells me the actual temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Neat but highly impractical
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of appreciation for the engineering that went into making this mug work but after living with it for a short amount of time you realize that the battery lasts so little time you really would have been better off buying a vacuum insulated mug. The actual volume of liquid the mug can handle vs its size is underwhelming as well..
customer_reviews.author: cTall

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to last 2 hours. Battery was fully charged (on the charger for a full day)...needed an update that took 2 minutes which was done on the charger...mug died completely on my 20 minute drive to work. Also has to virtually be sitting on the counter to do anything with it...like turn it on....touching the cup anywhere makes it unable to recognize your touch on the ember logo. Just overall very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: LissaLoo

customer_reviews.title: Charge only lasts 1 hour.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, poor execution. Only lasts about 1 hour fully charged
customer_reviews.author: Scott Saxon

customer_reviews.title: Travel mug so awesome for on the go life
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely inlove with my travel mug. My job requires a lot of traveling as well as a lot of coffee so I can always have my coffee hot and ready to go. It’s the perfect size. Set up was easy. Love that I can work and don’t have to worry about heating my coffee up or leaving dairy items get cold.
customer_reviews.author: jacquie

customer_reviews.title: Love the Ember
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Ember Travel Mug for over a month now and I love it. My coffee never gets cold and is always the perfect temp. Setup with the app was really easy. As is controlling the temp from the app and the mug. I love that I was able to name it and the name comes up every time I turn it on. Having a charger at work is great as the battery never runs out. Great technology, great mug! I highly recommend for avid coffee drinkers who like there coffee at the perfect temp all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mich8990

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like this, but mug DOA. Works when I have it on the charger, but not when off, even if battery is 72% as reported by the app. Also, firmware doesn't update with mysterious error code. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Ben G

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly, highly, highly recommend this product. I use it everyday honestly. I could donate every single coffee mug in my house and only use this mug. Easy to use, amazing features and keeps beverages hot for longer than you will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Hinote

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. A Yeti tumbler will keep your coffee warmer for longer. Grave disappointment. Waste of $150 bucks. It was a gift so I can’t return it.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last even a year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these about 3 months apart. Each worked great for 8 to 10 months then both died. Won’t purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hanschke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product *MUST HAVE*
customer_reviews.text: I love this mug so much! I sit at a desk and don’t have time to run to the microwave every time my tea or coffee cools. I like that I don’t have to drink quickly to avoid cooling. Every time I reach for it it’s my preferred temp. Because I use it at my desk I don’t have issues with battery life. After 8 months my lid wouldn’t stay in the locked open position. I contacted Ember support and received a replacement within a week at no charge. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Meinke

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste the money
customer_reviews.text: Battery doesn't even last 15 mins , device connected to bluetooth but not the app and the lid doesn't function nicely. For sure returning this, waste of a Christmas present.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for birthday in Nov 2017 and it has been perfect since. He

I reached out to Ember.com and within an hour had a new lid on the way to me. GREAT customer service is hard to find these days...and they rocked it. I'm not afraid to give this as a gift for this very reason...and will likely be purchasing more.

customer_reviews.title: This mug is not a travel mug. The battery ...
customer_reviews.text: This mug is not a travel mug. The battery only lasts for 20min and does not heat up enough to steep tea. The price is much too high for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: The product does not work
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn't charge, and it didn't work. I couldn't use it because it doesn't work. When I received it, the mug smelled like coffee. Like it was used by someone else before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect travel mug!
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this travel mug! SO worth the price. I love that you can control the temperature with your phone or with the mug itself. It keeps my coffee and tea at the perfect temperature for so long and you don't have to worry about the outside being too hot, it's all self contained! Also on a purely aesthetic level it looks great and expensive, I definitely feel fancy drinking out of it at work. All my coworkers are buying one now. Would highly recommend to everyone. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A new way to start your day
customer_reviews.text: I must start by saying I was skeptical about the idea of spending this much $ on a coffee mug. But now, I’m soooo happy I did! I no longer need to worry about reheating my coffee in the morning because it cooled off or not being able to drink it because it’s too hot. All I do is throw a pod in my keurig, fill the mug and wait a few minutes and prestó! My coffee is ready and will stay ready for hours. This mug has completely changed my coffee drinking experience, now I can now enjoy cup after cup at my favorite temperature. I certainly recommend this to anyone that truly enjoys their morning cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in this product. It stopped working after a week. I purchased a new coaster just in case that was the issue and it still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Shana Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, your mug will be used and filthy.
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the worst product I have gotten from amazon or it’s sellers. The mug came used, charging stand was dirty and mug still had water in it, which had grown mold on the inner part of the mug. When turned on, the display read “Christina’s mug.” Do not buy this product from these sham artists!!
customer_reviews.author: Kara Hartlaub

customer_reviews.title: Great, when it works
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 11 months. Now it won’t take a charge. Expensive for the life-span. I tried reaching out to Ember's support and they made a suggestion, which I tried but it didn't work. I asked them for next steps and they never responded again. UPDATE: they got back to me and had me send the travel mug back to them. They examined it and determined it was faulty and sent me a new one free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: ksaw

customer_reviews.title: Heaven for a tea lover
customer_reviews.text: As someone who drinks tea multiple times per day, I had always known that varying teas had a different optimal temperature for seeping and consumption. For example, Green tea at 150, white tea at 180 while black tea at around 190-200. I simply had no method of controlling that out of my mug till I found Ember. The mug has significantly improved my tea drinking experience. I also enjoy experiencing a product -mug- that I've used my whole life in a whole new way. The future is here =)
customer_reviews.author: Pappi

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn’t last like it says
customer_reviews.text: Charged the mug to fully charged first use and it last barely an hour Half the time it says it will last
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory terrible for surreal life
customer_reviews.text: Honest review the only way this mug keeps your coffee hot is if it is on the charging base and if the heat is on it will not charge above 46% and even from a full charge it will not last 2 hrs if heated at 145° dont get me wrong its ok if you work where it can sit on the base but if you are traveling your better off getting a $20 ozark from walmart im sorry but i would not recommend paying for this again..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mug, but still room for improvements
customer_reviews.text: Likes: The travel mug really does keep your drink at the perfect temperature and does not get hot on the exterior at all. It has a nice balanced weight when full and the lid is quiet when being opened and closed, perfect for meetings. It brings your drink to the desired temperature quickly if it has fallen below. Dislikes: Battery life is lite for a travel mug (just under 2 hours) and when the battery gets to 10% it stops maintaining the temperature as if it were turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: If they could only fix the battery life
customer_reviews.text: For the money, the battery life is just too short and takes too long to charge. Also pairing to you phone is clunky - you have to place it on the charger to pair and it takes several attempts.
customer_reviews.author: John G Heyliger

customer_reviews.title: This is James Bond material! I can control the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is James Bond material! I can control the temperature of my coffee during my one hour Los Angeles morning commute though my phone! Before I received the mug, I was not 100% sure of how user-friendly the app would be and how well it would actually connect with the mug. After testing for a few days, I am absolutely thrilled about both the looks and the functionality of the travel mug. I am definitely going to buy a few more to bring to my parents and extended family in Sweden for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: stefan

customer_reviews.title: Program it to your perfect temperature!
customer_reviews.text: This mug works great, I got it to take on the go with me to school and work. The mug is very durable and the lid is perfect and no spills as long as the lid is closed. I like that I can take a client and still have my tea warm still after I’m through and I can also leave it on the charger if I know I’ll be longer then a hour.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Prieto

customer_reviews.title: Lid no longer seals
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mug, but unfortunately, it leaks. The lid no longer seals. I keep trying to secure it and it continues to turn and turn and turn.... I have had it for one year, but only used it AT MOST 3 days per week for about 6 months. I find this unacceptable for such an expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn M.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend, too expensive for what you get
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn’t hold battery charge for 2 hours as advertised. If not ON, it won’t hold any warmth like a normal insulated mug might. I’ve had mine for 4 months and the lid is now broke to where I can’t push it down for it to open so I can sip my coffee. I have to completely remove the lid each time to drink it. It’s way too expensive for what you’re getting. I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Shonkwiler

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: After a year and half, my lid broke when i was washing it. I contacted Ember and they replaced the lid right away for free. Very good service and support. If your readings in your digital mug are slow to show up,then once i a while you have to reset your mug with a clip in a little hole at the bottom of the mug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received broken.  Cannot take it back, because I didn't open it until a few months after getting.
customer_reviews.text: Charged up fully, but had cold coffee a half hour later.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is such a phenomenal idea but the actual product was disappointing, primarily because of the battery life. It barely holds a charge. The battery lasts longer if you’re using it to maintain a hot temperature, but once it gets to the point it has to reheat coffee the batter is drained in 20mins. I love the idea, I just wish it held a charge.
customer_reviews.author: lindsay howell

customer_reviews.title: Good product, and am looking forward to version 2.0.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but wish the battery would last longer. The app has trouble gracefully exiting after pairing with mug each day. Needs to be force quit via Android app settings.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased this for my wife and she is in love with it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife and she is in love with it. So much so that she wants to purchase one for me. Thurmoses really are not my thing, but this one is impressive and she loves hers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loses battery fast/ does not stay warm
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift and they returned it!!! The battery dies fast and it does not stay warm. Better off with a regular metal coffee thermos from Starbucks. So embarrassing!!!
customer_reviews.author: tracy villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Ember travel Mug
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love my new travel mug. My husband and I wake up early on weekends, get into our car and drive somewhere new. He goes golfing and I go for a walk. This was the first weekend with my new travel mug and it was amazing. My coffee stayed at the same hot temperature of 140 degrees that I love. I was able to sip It slowly without worrying about it getting cold. My first drink was just as good as the last. I know what I’m getting my husband for Christmas. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Ember Mug for my wife for Mother's Day, and we were both so impressed with it that I bought a second one for me. Easy to set up and use, the Mug has become one of those nice additions to our daily lives that bring a smile to our faces. It's one of those products that does exactly what the ads promise it will do!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Messer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend buying this mug. The battery only lasts for an hour or so. Great idea, poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: How do I get the mug to hold a charge?
customer_reviews.text: Worked for the first 10 times I used it, now it doesn't charge even if I leave it on the charger for hours. It just keeps charging but doesn't actually charge. As soon as I take it from the charger it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Coffee always hot.  When will it automatically refill itself?
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was bigger by a couple of ounces. I like all the coffee and lots of room for cream. It really does keep the coffee at temp, all the way to the last drop. I can't wait to see what this company comes up with next!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating Temperature not well controlled Short battery life Difficult to clean Bought two and both failed to operate after a while
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine so far
customer_reviews.text: First one broke down after like 3 uses, but they replaced it. Let's see how long this one keeps. Also battery could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Best travel mug ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best travel mugs that I found in the market which is leak-proof and keeps my coffee at the perfect temperature. This is a very high tech mug. I have to set the temperature only at once and it remembers it everytime I pour my coffee into it. It is a perfect size mug. I love the ember android app. When I pour hot coffee into the mug app turns to orange color and with cold liquid it turns to grey. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Manjit Singh

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Mug!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic innovation in mugs! It does what it says it will do - keeps the beverage to the set temperature for 2 hours which is the length of the battery. After that the temperature begins to drop. The directions are clear except that the mug needs to be charged on the coaster before it can be programmed. And it doesn't give directions for how to drink - just push down on the middle of the lid - no need to unscrew the top in order to drink.
customer_reviews.author: CLB

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like it it can’t keep my coffee warm for more than one and a half hours
customer_reviews.author: Aldhuhayyan

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend to anybody
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months the cup now only works intermittently. Amazon only allows returns for 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: Slimpim

customer_reviews.title: Work great until the cap snapped in the middle
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months the cap broke. It should last more than that
customer_reviews.author: jill Moody

customer_reviews.title: I love this cup
customer_reviews.text: I love this cup! It does exactly what it promises. My coffee was hotter when I got to work than when I left home! It is easy to set user preferences and is always a conversation starter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive 12oz travel mug.
customer_reviews.text: Seem like this product needs more insulation. 12 oz is a good size for small travel mugs, when the battery dies your coffee cools fast. Good idea for keeping your liquids warm for about 30 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Philip S Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a good thermos
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive when you can just get a regular thermos that keeps coffee or drinks just as hot for the same amount of time
customer_reviews.author: AKS

customer_reviews.title: Functionality
customer_reviews.text: If you are in Hectic job, not very useful as you need to keep on the charging unit, If you have a light duty job then excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
